name: "Cobra Kai Needs You!" Screenprinted Poster (Artist Proof)
description: “Cobra Kai Needs You!” an original illustrated 18” x 24”, 5 colour screenprinted poster (ARTIST PROOF) - original run of 15. Produced for Gauntlet Gallery in San Francisco for the art show “Where We’re Going, We Don’t Need Roads: An Art Show Inspired By 80s Movies”. The poster is on 315gsm heritage white paper, and was screenprinted by hand, by Suki at the Print Block in Whitstable. All prints are now shipped via Royal Mail tracked delivery. The print is also available as a mens/ladies t-shirt here.

name: "Shuggie Otis At Jazz Cafe" A3 Gig Poster
description:
To celebrate famed 70s soul/folk musician Shuggie Otis' triumphant return to the stage in 30 years at London’s Jazz Cafe, Sony Music/Legacy Recordings commissioned this stunning gig poster, illustrated by Greg Bunbury. A must-have for Shuggie fans, gig poster enthusiasts, and anyone wanting a memento from the 20-21st November 2012 shows.

“Shuggie Otis At Jazz Cafe”. A3 digital print on on 300gsm matte board by Bmarket.

name: "Miskatonic: The Return Of Dr Hill" Screenprinted Poster Inspired by "Re-Animator"
description:
“Miskatonic” is an illustrated poster inspired by cult 1985 horror classic "Re-Animator" (directed by Stuart Gordon), and the original story by horror/fantasy/science fiction author H.P. Lovecraft.

Originally produced for the Bottleneck Gallery NYC, for the “Can’t Beat Em, Join Em: The Zombie Show”, the piece depicts the fictional "Miskatonic University".

Much of Lovecraft’s work has featured this fictional University, and I took inspiration from the original story – here Miskatonic is presented as an old, prestigious school, and combined it with a key moment in the 1985 film (which never actually happens on camera), when the villainous "Dr Carl Hill" returns to Miskatonic with the intention of creating zombies from the University morgue. It is the imagining of this scene which created the basis for the illustration. 

One for horror enthusiasts, and Lovecraft fans alike!

"Miskatonic" is a 4 colour hand-pulled screenprint from Bmarket, on 315gsm heritage white paper. A signed and numbered edition of 20. Printed by The Print Block, Whitstable. 

All prints are now shipped via Royal Mail tracked delivery.

name: "The Sopranos" Screenprinted Poster - LAST FEW! EXTRAS/RETURNS/DAMAGED
description: Priced to clear! 18" x 24" Screen printed illustrated poster of everyone's favourite dysfunctional family. Originally produced for the Bottleneck Gallery NYC show, "More Than You Imagined: Art Inspired by Premium Cable [9/7/12 - 9/28/12]". Printed by KW Screen printing in Oregon, Portland for Bmarket. Signed and numbered, edition of 50. Last few remaining prints! Remainder consist of returns, printer's extras and slightly damaged prints, due to bad shipping and general wear and tear during transport. The most prominent damage consists of a small crease in the bottom left corner, less than 2mm wide. Some prints will have a slight crease on the edge a bit further up, about 2mm wide. PLEASE NOTE none of the minor damage will be visible once the print is framed. You can view the marks here. Printer's extras are mostly unblemished, and are be signed and marked, but not numbered as part of the edition. I will endeavour to get you the best quality print available, on a first-come first-served basis, but please note there are no returns on these prints. The clearance price is less than the shipping in some cases! These are still high quality 3 colour, hand-pulled screenprinted posters, at the price you'd expect to pay for a standard digital print. All prints are now shipped via Royal Mail tracked delivery. The print is also available as a mens/ladies t-shirt here.
